title: Stories from Scottish history /
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: But Cressingham the treasurer, who was ignorant and presumptuous, insisted that it was their duty to fight, and put an end to the war at once ; and Lundin gave way to his opinion, although Cressingham, being a churchman,  could not be so good a judge of what was fitting as he himself, an experienced ofificer.

title: Tales of a Grandfather ... [ser. 1-3.] With notes
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: But Cressingham, the treasurer, who was ignorant and presumptuous, insisted that it was their duty to fight,and put an end to the war at once ; and Lundingave way to his opinion, although Cressingham,being a churchman, could not be so good a judgeof what was fitting as he himself, an experiencedofficer.
